title.native: 魔法少女マジカルデストロイヤーズ

description:
Freedom of expression is threatened when a mysterious group, the SSC, destroy Japan’s otaku culture. However, a young revolutionary, Otaku Hero—who loves the culture more than anything—rises up. With the help of three rambunctious magical girls—Anarchy, Blue, and Pink—they’ll team up to create a world free of this oppressive rule. Be part of the rebellion to bring back fandom!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: สาวน้อยเวทมนตร์จอมล้างผลาญ

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Swimming
tags.description: Centers around the sport of swimming.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Cars
tags.description: Centers around the use of automotive vehicles.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

title.native: マジデス壊 魔法少女マジカルデストロイヤーズ PV

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aho_boy)

Hiroshi Ikehata is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimi_sound) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimin_official/)

A voice actor and musician, notably the lead vocalist and guitarist of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Aimi had dreamed of becoming a singer ever since she was young. She initially only aspired to become a singer, but she became interested in voice acting after becoming familiar with the anime series Macross Frontier, where she was impressed at how the series was able to combine music and animation in its storytelling. 

In order to make her dream come true, she participated in various contests, such as the “Best of Singer Contest National Championship 2008”, which she made into the Finals but lost. She was one of 3rd ANIMAX Anison Grand Prix Finalists with Sayaka Sasaki in 2009, and was a winner of the Osaka block. On February 6th, 2010, she made it to the finals of the “Aim for Ellie! Milky Holmes Seiyuu Audition”, a seiyuu audition tour hosted by DWANGO Creative School, but lost the role to Mikoi Sasaki. However, she did make her debut as a seiyuu in the Milky Holmes anime.

Aimi was the guitarist of a girls' band in high school and self-taught, but quit playing after graduating. She picked it up back in 2014 and used it to perform during her THE iDOLM@STER Million Live! live performances as Julia. Aimi is the influence and where Kidani Takaaki, the president of Bushiroad, got his idea for the BanG Dream! franchise from - after seeing Aimi playing the guitar during THE IDOLM@STER M@STERS OF IDOL WORLD!! 2014. 

She used her full name for her voice actress career and Aimi (愛美) for her singer career, but she started to use the latter for both since December 2013.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Brünhilde - Azur Lane (VG)
- Mica - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Serval - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Yan - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Cristallo - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/konnotato) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/2297808)

A freelance illustrator and animator. After graduating from Seian University of Art and Design's Japanese-style Painting course, he joined Shaft. There, he did in-between animation for the Puella Magi Madoka Magica movies and the Monogatari series, as well as key animation for Monogatari Second Season and Mekakucity Actors. After leaving Shaft, he worked on Fate/Grand Order Absolute Demonic Front: Babylonia as an animation director.

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.
Mitsuharu Itou is a recording engineer.

__[Website](https://aaequal.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_aaequal) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/takeshi.aaequal)__

__Takeshi Ueda__ is a Japanese bassist, vocalist, lyricist and music producer.

__[Website](https://aaequal.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_aaequal) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/takeshi.aaequal)__

__Takeshi Ueda__ is a Japanese bassist, vocalist, lyricist and music producer.
